definition: to turn back/to retrace one's steps
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: The road ahead is flooded so we have to double back.
sentences.chinese: 前面的路已遭水淹，我們只好原路折回。

sentences.english: And the Priest trembled, and returned to his own house and prayed.
sentences.chinese: 牧師於是顫抖起來，折回自己的房間禱告去了。

sentences.english: The hounds harked back to the dells.
sentences.chinese: 獵犬折回小山谷想再找尋到嗅跡。

sentences.english: And we gaily return to the miry path.
sentences.chinese: 我們又愉快地折回泥濘的道路。

sentences.english: At the last minute they turned back and escaped the attack.
sentences.chinese: 他們在最後一刻折回，逃過一劫。

sentences.english: She went back to get her handbag.
sentences.chinese: 他折回去拿他的手提包。

sentences.english: By the time the eagle had found his way back to the right place, all that was left was a broken piece of shell.
sentences.chinese: 當鷹尋舊路折回時，地上只剩下一些破碎的果殼了。

sentences.english: At length I thought I might return towards the stockade.
sentences.chinese: 我終於覺得可以折回來向木寨方向走去了。

sentences.english: Then he retraced his steps to the port and returned to England.
sentences.chinese: 接着他折回港口，返回了英國。

sentences.english: We untrod our steps to where we started.
sentences.chinese: 我們順原路折回到我們出發的地方。

sentences.english: The escaped boy doubled back on his tracks.
sentences.chinese: 那個逃跑的男孩突然循原路折回。

sentences.english: But in the minds of the nostalgic of the motherland, and therefore net Dongting.
sentences.chinese: 但心中總在眷戀着祖國，於是又折回洞庭。

sentences.english: Just at that time, the cat unwilling to give up returned back.
sentences.chinese: 正在這個時候，這只不死心的貓又折回來了。

sentences.english: He repassed the street when he saw the policeman coming up.
sentences.chinese: 當他看到警察走來時他又穿過大街折回。
那時，幾營漢諾威軍隊向後折回了。

sentences.english: Two sentinels had fallen back, and had come in almost at the same moment as Gavroche.
sentences.chinese: 兩個哨兵也折回來了，幾乎是和伽弗洛什同時到達的。

definition: to turn back
to return/to go back/to come back
to turn around
to break into a run
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
to go home (in a ceremonial procession)/to return home
to go straight to/to make a beeline for
to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
to revolve/to rotate/rotation
halfway/midway
to take the back roads/to take the side streets/to take the small paths
to rush out
to turn back/to put back/reversal/melodic inversion (in music)
to go on a journey/to leave
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
tone (of voice)/tune
variant of 掉頭|掉头[diao4 tou2]
